definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
(arch.) minister/official/noun prefix denoting function or status/a youth
more or less/or so (of approx age or number)/and so on

sentences.english: Lang did not know a thing, getting a bad temper.
sentences.chinese: 不晓得啷个回事，脾气变得越来越坏。

sentences.english: The swordman only felt a sudden pain on his wrist and dropped his sword.
sentences.chinese: 那剑士只觉腕上一阵剧痛，呛啷一声，长剑落地。

sentences.english: Sometimes, I stayed up into the late night, surfing on the internet. I would hear the door open.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔，我上网到后半夜，水果店的卷闸门啷一声拉起。

sentences.english: How can I go to the market?
With a clatter, the flatterer shattered the chattering wattmeter in the chaos.
sentences.chinese: 卖啷一声，马屁精在杂沓中打碎了格格作响的瓦特表。
监狱的大门匡啷一声关上了。

sentences.english: The spurs of the cavalry officer clanged as he walked across the porch.
sentences.chinese: 骑兵军官从廊上走过，马刺嗑啷嗑啷地响。

sentences.english: The spurs of the cavalry officer clanged as he walked across the porch.
sentences.chinese: 骑兵军官从廊上走过，马刺嗑啷嗑啷地响。

sentences.english: Daydream in the evening dream of bloodcurdling thing Lang do also?
sentences.chinese: 晚上做梦梦见恐怖的东西啷个办也？

sentences.english: She clashed those cups down on the floor .
sentences.chinese: 她把那些杯子啷一声碰掉到地板上。

definition: (onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
